name: Path N NET Small Intestine
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily is not met, classify as pN0.

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Regional lymph nodes for small intestine**

**Duodenum primaries only (C170):**

    Duodenal
    Gastroduodenal
    Hepatic
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Pericholodochal (common bile duct)
    Pyloric: infrapyloric, subpyloric
    Superior mesenteric
       
**Jejunum primaries only (C171):**

     Mesenteric, NOS:
     Superior mesenteric

**Ileum primaries only (C172):**

     Cecal (anterior, posterior, retrocecal) 
     Ileocecal       
     Mesenteric, NOS
     Superior mesenteric
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Pathologic N is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no Tis defined)

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of the primary
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
